issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
Currently,Â HiveProtoLoggingHook write event data to hdfs. The number of files can grow to very large numbers.

Since the files are created under a folder with Date being a part of the path, hive should have a way to clean up data older than a certain configured time / date. This can be a job that can run with as little frequency as just once a day.

This time should be set to 1 week default. There should also be a sane upper bound of # of files so that when a large cluster generates a lot of files during a spike, we don't force the cluster fall over.
fields.summary: Clean-up of event files created by HiveProtoLoggingHook.
